verses.kjv: And the men of Ephraim gathered themselves together, and went northward, and said unto Jephthah, Wherefore passedst thou over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thine house upon thee with fire.
verses.ct: The men of Ephraim mobilized and crossed over to Zaphon. They confronted Jephthah, saying, "Why did you go to war against the Ammonites without calling us to join you? We're going to burn your house down with you inside it!"

verses.kjv: And Jephthah said unto them, I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, ye delivered me not out of their hands.
verses.ct: Jephthah replied, "My people and I were in a serious conflict with the Ammonites. I did call on you for help, but you refused to come rescue me from them."

verses.kjv: And when I saw that ye delivered me not, I put my life in my hands, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and the LORD delivered them into my hand: wherefore then are ye come up unto me this day, to fight against me?
verses.ct: "When I realized you weren't going to help me, I risked my own life and went to fight the Ammonites myself, and the LORD gave me victory over them. So why are you coming to pick a fight with me today?"

verses.kjv: Then Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim: and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim, because they said, Ye Gileadites are fugitives of Ephraim among the Ephraimites, and among the Manassites.
verses.ct: Jephthah then assembled all the men of Gilead and attacked Ephraim. The men of Gilead defeated Ephraim, because the Ephraimites had insulted them by saying, "You Gileadites are just runaway Ephraimites living between Ephraim and Manasseh."

verses.kjv: And the Gileadites took the passages of Jordan before the Ephraimites: and it was so, that when those Ephraimites which were escaped said, Let me go over; that the men of Gilead said unto him, Art thou an Ephraimite? If he said, Nay;
verses.ct: The Gileadites seized the crossing points of the Jordan River to cut off the Ephraimites. Whenever a surviving Ephraimite would say, "Let me cross over," the men of Gilead would ask him, "Are you an Ephraimite?" If he answered, "No,"

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, Say now Shibboleth: and he said Sibboleth: for he could not frame to pronounce it right. Then they took him, and slew him at the passages of Jordan: and there fell at that time of the Ephraimites forty and two thousand.
verses.ct: they would tell him, "Then say the word 'Shibboleth.'" He would say "Sibboleth" instead, because he couldn't pronounce it correctly. They would grab him and kill him right there at the river crossing. During that time, 42,000 Ephraimites were killed.

verses.kjv: And Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then died Jephthah the Gileadite, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
verses.ct: Jephthah led Israel for 6 years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and was buried in one of the towns of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And after him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.
verses.ct: After him, Ibzan from Bethlehem led Israel.

verses.kjv: And he had thirty sons, and thirty daughters, whom he sent abroad, and took in thirty daughters from abroad for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.
verses.ct: He had 30 sons and 30 daughters. He married his daughters off to men outside his clan and brought in 30 wives from outside his clan for his sons. He led Israel for 7 years.

verses.kjv: Then died Ibzan, and was buried at Bethlehem.
verses.ct: Then Ibzan died and was buried in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And after him Elon, a Zebulonite, judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.
verses.ct: After him, Elon from the tribe of Zebulun led Israel. He served as Israel's leader for 10 years.

verses.kjv: And Elon the Zebulonite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the country of Zebulun.
verses.ct: Then Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried in Aijalon in the territory of Zebulun.

verses.kjv: And after him Abdon the son of Hillel, a Pirathonite, judged Israel.
verses.ct: After him, Abdon son of Hillel, from Pirathon, led Israel.

verses.kjv: And he had forty sons and thirty nephews, that rode on threescore and ten ass colts: and he judged Israel eight years.
verses.ct: He had 40 sons and 30 grandsons, who rode on 70 donkeys. He led Israel for 8 years.

verses.kjv: And Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the mount of the Amalekites.
verses.ct: Then Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite died and was buried in Pirathon, in the territory of Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.
